column2: Lobsters and Lobsters
column3: Lobsters and Lobsters

column2: When is a lobster not a lobster?
column3: When is a lobster not a lobster?

column2: When it is a crayfish.
column3: When it is a crayfish.

column2: This question and answer might well go into the primer of information for those who come to San Francisco from the East, for what is called a lobster in San Francisco is not a lobster at all but a crayfish.
column3: This question and answer might well go into the primer of information for those who come to San Francisco from the East, for what is called a lobster in San Francisco is not a lobster at all but a crayfish.

column2: The true lobster is not found in the Pacific along the California coast, and so far efforts at transplanting have not been successful.
column3: The true lobster is not found in the Pacific along the California coast, and so far efforts at transplanting have not been successful.

column2: The Pacific crayfish, however, serves every purpose, and while many contend that its meat is not so delicate in flavor as that of its eastern cousin, the Californian will as strenuously insist that it is better, but, of course, something must always be allowed for the patriotism of the Californian.
column3: The Pacific crayfish, however, serves every purpose, and while many contend that its meat is not so delicate in flavor as that of its eastern cousin, the Californian will as strenuously insist that it is better, but, of course, something must always be allowed for the patriotism of the Californian.

column2: Lobster, served cold with mayonnaise, or broiled live lobster are most frequently called for, and while they are both excellent, we find so many other ways of preparing this crustacean that we rarely take the common variety of lobster dishes into consideration.
column3: Lobster, served cold with mayonnaise, or broiled live lobster are most frequently called for, and while they are both excellent, we find so many other ways of preparing this crustacean that we rarely take the common variety of lobster dishes into consideration.

column2: Probably nowhere in San Francisco could one get lobster better served than in the Old Delmonico restaurant of the days before the fire.
column3: Probably nowhere in San Francisco could one get lobster better served than in the Old Delmonico restaurant of the days before the fire.

column2: A book could be written about this restaurant and then all would not be told for all its secrets can never be known.
column3: A book could be written about this restaurant and then all would not be told for all its secrets can never be known.

column2: In New York City they have what they are pleased to call "Lobster Palaces," but there is not a restaurant in that great metropolis that could approach the Delmonico of San Francisco in its splendid service and its cuisine arrangements; neither could they approach the romance that always surrounded the O'Farrell street restaurant.
column3: In New York City they have what they are pleased to call "Lobster Palaces," but there is not a restaurant in that great metropolis that could approach the Delmonico of San Francisco in its splendid service and its cuisine arrangements; neither could they approach the romance that always surrounded the O'Farrell street restaurant.

column2: It was here that most magnificent dinners were arranged; it was here that extraordinary dishes were concocted by chefs of world-wide fame; it was here that Lobster a la Newberg reached its highest perfection, and this is the recipe that was followed when it was prepared in the Delmonico:
column3: It was here that most magnificent dinners were arranged; it was here that extraordinary dishes were concocted by chefs of world-wide fame; it was here that Lobster a la Newberg reached its highest perfection, and this is the recipe that was followed when it was prepared in the Delmonico:

column2: Lobster a la Newberg
column3: Lobster a la Newberg

column2: One pound of lobster meat, one teaspoonful of butter, one-half pint of cream, yolks of four eggs, one wine glass of sherry, lobster fat.
column3: One pound of lobster meat, one teaspoonful of butter, one half pint of cream, yolks of four eggs, one wine glass of sherry, lobster fat.

column2: Three hours before cooking pour the sherry over the lobster meat and let it stand until ready to cook.
column3: Three hours before cooking pour the sherry over the lobster meat and let it stand until ready to cook.

column2: Heat the butter and stir in with the lobster and wine, then place this in a stewpan, or chafing dish, and cook for eight minutes.
column3: Heat the butter and stir in with the lobster and wine, then place this in a stewpan, or chafing dish, and cook for eight minutes.

column2: Have the yolks of eggs well beaten and add to them the cream and lobster fat, stir well and then stir in a teaspoonful of flour.
column3: Have the yolks of eggs well beaten and add to them the cream and lobster fat, stir well and then stir in a teaspoonful of flour.

column2: Put this in a double boiler and let cook until thick, stirring constantly.
column3: Put this in a double boiler and let cook until thick, stirring constantly.

column2: When this is cooked pour it over the lobster and let all cook together for three minutes.
column3: When this is cooked pour it over the lobster and let all cook together for three minutes.

column2: Serve in a chafing dish with thin slices of dry toast.
column3: Serve in a chafing dish with thin slices of dry toast.

column2: King of Shell Fish
column3: King of Shell Fish

column2: One has to come to San Francisco to partake of the king of shell fish-- the mammoth Pacific crab.
column3: One has to come to San Francisco to partake of the king of shell fish- the mammoth Pacific crab.

column2: I say "come to San Francisco" advisedly, for while the crab is found all along the coast it is prepared nowhere so deliciously as in San Francisco.
column3: I say "come to San Francisco" advisedly, for while the crab is found all along the coast it is prepared nowhere so deliciously as in San Francisco.

column2: Of course our friends in Portland will take exception to this, but the fact remains that nowhere except in San Francisco have so many restaurants become famous because of the way they prepare the crab.
column3: Of course our friends in Portland will take exception to this, but the fact remains that nowhere except in San Francisco have so many restaurants become famous because of the way they prepare the crab.

column2: The Pacific crab is peculiar, and while it has not the gigantic claws such as are to be seen on those in the Parisian and London markets, its meat is much more delicate in flavor, and the dishes of crab prepared by artists of the gastronomic profession in San Francisco are more savory than those found elsewhere.
column3: The Pacific crab is peculiar, and while it has not the gigantic claws such as are to be seen on those in the Parisian and London markets, its meat is much more delicate in flavor, and the dishes of crab prepared by artists of the gastronomic profession in San Francisco are more savory than those found elsewhere.

column2: In the pre-fire days there were many places which paid especial attention to the cooking of the crab, among them being the Cobweb Palace, previously mentioned, and Gobey's.
column3: In the pre fire days there were many places which paid especial attention to the cooking of the crab, among them being the Cobweb Palace, previously mentioned, and Gobey's.

column2: Gobey ran one of those places which was not in good repute, consequently when ladies went there they were usually veiled and slipped in through an alley, but the enticement of Gobey's crab stew was too much for conventionality and his little private rooms were always full.
column3: Gobey ran one of those places which was not in good repute, consequently when ladies went there they were usually veiled and slipped in through an alley, but the enticement of Gobey's crab stew was too much for conventionality and his little private rooms were always full.

column2: Gobey's passed with the fire, and the little restaurant bearing his name, and in charge of his widow, in Union Square avenue, has not attained the fame of the old place.
column3: Gobey's passed with the fire, and the little restaurant bearing his name, and in charge of his widow, in Union Square avenue, has not attained the fame of the old place.

column2: It is possible that she knows the secret of preparing crab as it was prepared in the Gobey's of before the fire, but his prestige did not descend to her.
column3: It is possible that she knows the secret of preparing crab as it was prepared in the Gobey's of before the fire, but his prestige did not descend to her.

column2: Almost all of the Italian restaurants will give you crab in many forms, and all of them are good; many restaurants use crab meat for flavoring other, dishes, but of all the recipes for cooking crab we have found none that we consider so good as that of Gobey's.
column3: Almost all of the Italian restaurants will give you crab in many forms, and all of them are good; many restaurants use crab meat for flavoring other, dishes, but of all the recipes for cooking crab we have found none that we consider so good as that of Gobey's.

column2: It is as follows:
column3: It is as follows:

column2: Gobey's Crab Stew
column3: Gobey's Crab Stew

column2: Take the meat of one large crab, scraping out all of the fat from the shell.
column3: Take the meat of one large crab, scraping out all of the fat from the shell.

column2: One good-sized onion, one tomato, one sweet pepper, one teaspoonful of butter, one teaspoonful of flour, half a glass of sherry, a pinch of rosemary, one clove of garlic, paprika, salt and minionette pepper.
column3: One good sized onion, one tomato, one sweet pepper, one teaspoonful of butter, one teaspoonful of flour, half a glass of sherry, a pinch of rosemary, one clove of garlic, paprika, salt and minionette pepper.

column2: Soak the crab meat in the sherry two hours before cooking.
column3: Soak the crab meat in the sherry two hours before cooking.

column2: Chop fine the onion, sweet pepper and tomato with the rosemary.
column3: Chop fine the onion, sweet pepper and tomato with the rosemary.

column2: Mash the clove of garlic, rubbing thoroughly in a mortar and on this put the butter and flour, mixing well together, and gradually adding the salt and minionette pepper, and stir in two tablespoonfuls of cream.
column3: Mash the clove of garlic, rubbing thoroughly in a mortar and on this put the butter and flour, mixing well together, and gradually adding the salt and minionette pepper, and stir in two tablespoonfuls of cream.

column2: Heat this in a stewpan and when simmering add the sherry and crab meat and let all cook together with a slow fire for eight minutes.
column3: Heat this in a stewpan and when simmering add the sherry and crab meat and let all cook together with a slow fire for eight minutes.

column2: Serve in a chafing dish with toasted crackers or thin slices of toasted bread.
column3: Serve in a chafing dish with toasted crackers or thin slices of toasted bread.

column2: A dash of Worcestershire sauce just before it is taken up adds to the flavor.
column3: A dash of Worcestershire sauce just before it is taken up adds to the flavor.

column2: Crawfish, or ecravisse, has never been very popular in San Francisco, probably because there are so many other delicate crustaceans that are more easily handled, yet the crawfish grows to perfection in Pacific waters, and importation's of them from Portland, Oregon, are becoming quite an industry.
column3: Crawfish, or ecravisse, has never been very popular in San Francisco, probably because there are so many other delicate crustaceans that are more easily handled, yet the crawfish grows to perfection in Pacific waters, and importation's of them from portland oregon, are becoming quite an industry.

column2: So far it has been used mostly for garnishment of other dishes, and it is only recently that the Hof Brau has been making a specialty of them.
column3: So far it has been used mostly for garnishment of other dishes, and it is only recently that the Hof Brau has been making a specialty of them.

column2: All of the better class restaurants, however, will serve them if you order them.
column3: All of the better class restaurants, however, will serve them if you order them.

column2: The full flavor of the crawfish is best obtained in a bisque, and the best recipe for this is by the famous chef Francatelli, who boasts having been the head of the cuisine of Queen Victoria.
column3: The full flavor of the crawfish is best obtained in a bisque, and the best recipe for this is by the famous chef Francatelli, who boasts having been the head of the cuisine of Queen Victoria.

column2: His recipe is long, and its preparation requires much patience, but the result is such a gastronomic marvel that one never regrets the time spent in its accomplishment.
column3: His recipe is long, and its preparation requires much patience, but the result is such a gastronomic marvel that one never regrets the time spent in its accomplishment.

column2: This is the recipe for eight people, and it is well worth trying if you are giving a dinner of importance:
column3: This is the recipe for eight people, and it is well worth trying if you are giving a dinner of importance:

column2: Bisque of Crawfish
column3: Bisque of Crawfish

column2: Take thirty crawfish, from which remove the gut containing the gall in the following manner: Take firm hold of the crawfish with the left hand so as to avoid being pinched by its claws; with the thumb and forefinger of the right hand pinch the extreme end of the central fin of the tail, and, with a sudden jerk, the gut will be withdrawn.
column3: Take thirty crawfish, from which remove the gut containing the gall in the following manner: Take firm hold of the crawfish with the left hand so as to avoid being pinched by its claws; with the thumb and forefinger of the right hand pinch the extreme end of the central fin of the tail, and, with a sudden jerk, the gut will be withdrawn.

column2: Mince or cut into small dice a carrot, an onion, one head of celery and a few parsley roots, and to these add a bay leaf, a sprig of thyme, a little minionette pepper and two ounces of butter.
column3: Mince or cut into small dice a carrot, an onion, one head of celery and a few parsley roots, and to these add a bay leaf, a sprig of thyme, a little minionette pepper and two ounces of butter.

column2: Put these ingredients into a stewpan and fry them ten minutes, then throw in the crawfish and pour on them half a bottle of French white wine.
column3: Put these ingredients into a stewpan and fry them ten minutes, then throw in the crawfish and pour on them half a bottle of French white wine.

column2: Allow this to boil and then add a quart of strong consomme and let all continue boiling for half an hour.
column3: Allow this to boil and then add a quart of strong consomme and let all continue boiling for half an hour.

column2: Pick out the crawfish and strain the broth through a napkin by pressure into a basin in order to extract all the essence from the vegetables.
column3: Pick out the crawfish and strain the broth through a napkin by pressure into a basin in order to extract all the essence from the vegetables.

column2: Pick the shells off twenty-five of the crawfish tails, trim them neatly and set them aside until wanted.
column3: Pick the shells off twenty five of the crawfish tails, trim them neatly and set them aside until wanted.

column2: Reserve some of the spawn, also half of the body shells with which to make the crawfish butter to finish the soup.
column3: Reserve some of the spawn, also half of the body shells with which to make the crawfish butter to finish the soup.

column2: This butter is made as follows: Place the shells on a baking sheet in the oven to dry; let the shells cool and then pound them in a mortar with a little lobster coral and four ounces of fresh butter, thoroughly bruising the whole together so as to make a fine paste.
column3: This butter is made as follows: Place the shells on a baking sheet in the oven to dry; let the shells cool and then pound them in a mortar with a little lobster coral and four ounces of fresh butter, thoroughly bruising the whole together so as to make a fine paste.

column2: Put this in a stewpan and set it over a slow fire to simmer for about five minutes, then rub it through a sieve with considerable pressure into a basin containing ice water.
column3: Put this in a stewpan and set it over a slow fire to simmer for about five minutes, then rub it through a sieve with considerable pressure into a basin containing ice water.

column2: As soon as the colored crawfish butter is become firmly set, through the coldness of the water, take it out and put it into a small basin and set in the refrigerator until wanted.
column3: As soon as the colored crawfish butter is become firmly set, through the coldness of the water, take it out and put it into a small basin and set in the refrigerator until wanted.

column2: Reverting to the original recipe: Take the remainder of the crawfish and add thereto three anchovies, washed for the purpose, and also the crusts of French rolls, fried to a light brown color in butter.
column3: Reverting to the original recipe: Take the remainder of the crawfish and add thereto three anchovies, washed for the purpose, and also the crusts of French rolls, fried to a light brown color in butter.

column2: Pound all these thoroughly together and then put them into a stewpan with the broth that has been reserved in a basin, and having warmed the bisque thus prepared rub it through a sieve into a fine puree.
column3: Pound all these thoroughly together and then put them into a stewpan with the broth that has been reserved in a basin, and having warmed the bisque thus prepared rub it through a sieve into a fine puree.

column2: Put this puree into a soup pot and finish by incorporating therewith the crawfish butter and season with a little cayenne pepper and the juice of half a lemon.
column3: Put this puree into a soup pot and finish by incorporating therewith the crawfish butter and season with a little cayenne pepper and the juice of half a lemon.

column2: Pour the bisque quite hot into the tureen in which have been placed the crawfish tails, and send to the table.
column3: Pour the bisque quite hot into the tureen in which have been placed the crawfish tails, and send to the table.

column2: This is not so difficult as it appears when you are reading it and if you wish to have something extra fine take the necessary time and patience and prepare it.
column3: This is not so difficult as it appears when you are reading it and if you wish to have something extra fine take the necessary time and patience and prepare it.

column2: Clams and Abalone's
column3: Clams and Abalone's

column2: We cannot dispose of the shell fish of San Francisco without a word or two about clams, for certainly there is no place where they are in greater variety and better flavor.
column3: We cannot dispose of the shell fish of San Francisco without a word or two about clams, for certainly there is no place where they are in greater variety and better flavor.

column2: In fact the clam is the only bivalve of this part of the coast that has a distinctive and good flavor. Several varieties are to be found in the markets, the best and rarest being the little rock clams that come from around Drake's Bay, just above the entrance to Golden Gate.
column3: In fact the clam is the only bivalve of this part of the coast that has a distinctive and good flavor. Several varieties are to be found in the markets, the best and rarest being the little rock clams that come from around Drake's Bay, just above the entrance to Golden Gate.

column2: These are most delicious in flavor and should never be eaten otherwise than raw.
column3: These are most delicious in flavor and should never be eaten otherwise than raw.

column2: The sand, or hard shell, or as they are sometimes called little necks, are next in choiceness, and then come the Pismo beach clams, noted for their flavor and enormous size.
column3: The sand, or hard shell, or as they are sometimes called little necks, are next in choiceness, and then come the Pismo beach clams, noted for their flavor and enormous size.

column2: The mud clam is good for chowder but not so good as either of the other varieties mentioned.
column3: The mud clam is good for chowder but not so good as either of the other varieties mentioned.
